intro: Hyospathe elegans subsp. costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican elegant hyospathe, is a member of the Araceae family. It is native to Central America, particularly found in Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescence consisting of a spadix surrounded by a colorful spathe. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often in tropical rainforests. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
